title: Rate Law for destruction of ozone

content.question: Based on the proposed mechanism, which of the following is the rate-law expression for the destruction of <math alttext="O 3 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of O 3, squared " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of C l squared " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>Cl</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of C l O, times the molar concentration of O 3 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><mtext>ClO</mtext><mo>]</mo><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration O 3, times the molar concentration of C l " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo><mo>[</mo><mtext>Cl</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration O 3, times the molar concentration of C l " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo><mo>[</mo><mtext>Cl</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
